Technical Assistance Report
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Project Number: 52257-001 
Transaction Technical Assistance Facility (F-TRTA) 
November 2018 
 
 
 
 
Proposed Loan 
Philippines: Expanded Social Assistance Project 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
This document is being disclosed to the public in accordance with ADB’s Public Communications 
 
Policy 2011.

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FACILITY1 
 
1.  The ongoing transaction technical assistance (TA) for Strengthening Social Protection 
Reforms was approved for $1 million in February 2016 as part of the PHI: Social Protection 
Support Project (Additional Financing). This TA is being proposed to be expanded into a TA facility 
with $1 million additional financing from the Asian Development Bank Technical Assistance 
Special Fund (TASF-Others). The TA facility will (i) continue ongoing policy and advisory and 
capacity development support to the executing agency under the ongoing loan, (ii) prepare the 
proposed Expanded Social Assistance Project and (iii) provide policy and advisory and capacity 
development support to the executing agency under the ensuing loan. 
 
2.  The TA facility will deliver the following outputs specifically for the ensuing Expanded 
Social Assistance Project. 
 
3.  Output 1: Policy gaps in social protection identified and options developed (2020-
2023). The TA will support the continued development of national policies for social protection 
(with a focus on social assistance) by identifying thematic areas where gaps exist. It will provide 
policy and advisory support under the government’s new Social Protection Framework and 
Operational Plan (expected to be approved in 2019). 
 
4.  Output 2: Operational gaps and governance risks in social protection service 
delivery identified and action plans prepared (2020-2023). This output will deploy consultants 
on an as needed basis to help the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) 
review its systems, business processes, financial management, and operations, particularly for 
the conditional cash transfer (CCT) and social pension programs. Recommendations will be 
provided in the form of proposed guidelines, revisions to manuals, or operational and financial 
management instructions. Areas of focus will include payments, financial management, and 
targeting.  
 
5.  Output 3: Knowledge products on best practices in social protection prepared and 
disseminated (2020-2023). Outputs 1 and 2 will inform the preparation of policy briefs and action 
plans to support the government’s social protection agenda—with a focus on the CCT, the social 
pension, and other social assistance. The briefs will provide policy options and proposed reforms 
that the government may adopt. This output will also support other knowledge products and 
publications on a demand-driven basis. 
 
1.  Output 4: New social protection project prepared (Q4 2018- Q1 2020) This output will 
identify the scope and coverage of the proposed Expanded Social Assistance Project, complete 
due diligence requirements, and prepare implementation arrangements. A team of consultants 
with expertise in social policy, digital payments, social pensions, financial management, poverty 
targeting, gender mainstreaming,  and  other  Asian  Development  Bank (ADB)  due  diligence 
requirements, will work closely with DSWD and ADB staff.
